verses.verse: (Israel Restored at Last) O Israel, (Hos. 12:6; (Joel 2:13)) return to the LORD your God, For you have stumbled because of your iniquity;
Take words with you, And return to the LORD. Say to Him, “Take away all iniquity; Receive us graciously, For we will offer the ((Ps. 51:16, 17; Hos. 6:6; Heb. 13:15)) sacrifices of our lips.

Assyria shall (Hos. 7:11; 10:13; 12:1) not save us, ((Ps. 33:17); Is. 31:1) We will not ride on horses, Nor will we say anymore to the work of our hands, ‘You are our gods.’ (Ps. 10:14; 68:5) For in You the fatherless finds mercy.”
“I will heal their (Jer. 14:7) backsliding, I will ((Eph. 1:6)) love them freely, For My anger has turned away from him.
I will be like the (Job 29:19; Prov. 19:12; Is. 26:19) dew to Israel; He shall grow like the lily, And lengthen his roots like Lebanon.
His branches shall spread; (Ps. 52:8; 128:3) His beauty shall be like an olive tree, And (Gen. 27:27) his fragrance like Lebanon.
(Dan. 4:12) Those who dwell under his shadow shall return; They shall be revived like grain, And grow like a vine. Their scent shall be like the wine of Lebanon.
“Ephraim shall say, ‘What have I to do anymore with idols?’ I have heard and observed him. I am like a green cypress tree; ((John 15:4)) Your fruit is found in Me.”

Who is wise? Let him understand these things. Who is prudent? Let him know them. For ((Ps. 111:7, 8; Prov. 10:29); Zeph. 3:5) the ways of the LORD are right; The righteous walk in them, But transgressors stumble in them.
